title: “وعظ” المواقع يعوض حكمة الواقع
summary: قبل سنوات، كانت المرأة تجد متنفسها في فضاءات بسيطة قريبة من حياتها اليومية، منها الحمام الشعبي الذي لم يكن مجرد مكان للاستحمام وتنظيف الجسد فحسب، بل كان، أيضا، مساحة اجتماعية بامتياز. هناك كانت النساء يتجاذبن أطراف الحديث، ويفضفضن عن همومهن، ويستمعن إلى تجارب غيرهن، ويخرجن منه بعدما يتخلصنأكمل القر…
body: قبل سنوات، كانت المرأة تجد متنفسها في فضاءات بسيطة قريبة من حياتها اليومية، منها الحمام الشعبي الذي لم يكن مجرد مكان للاستحمام وتنظيف الجسد فحسب، بل كان، أيضا، مساحة اجتماعية بامتياز. هناك كانت النساء يتجاذبن أطراف الحديث، ويفضفضن عن همومهن، ويستمعن إلى تجارب غيرهن، ويخرجن منه بعدما يتخلصن أكمل القراءة » المقالة “وعظ” المواقع يعوض حكمة الواقع fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: Tips and tricks to plan your career in science
summary:
Nature, Published online: 11 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02889-w

Julie Gould explores some of the theories and frameworks to help identify future work goals and achieve them.
body: Nature, Published online: 11 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02889-w Julie Gould explores some of the theories and frameworks to help identify future work goals and achieve them.

title: SpaceX Targets 2026 to Test Orbital Flight for Next-Gen Starship Vehicle
summary: Orbital missions will unlock the next phase of Starship’s development, providing data that would be essential for missions to Mars.

title: 'Our hearts stopped': Scientists find baby pterosaurs died in violent Jurassic storm 150 million years ago
summary: Researchers found storm injuries during a baby pterosaur post-mortem, solving a Jurassic mystery that was 150 million years in the making.

title: Stephen Hawking's long-contested black hole theory finally confirmed — as scientists  'hear' 2 event horizons merge into one
summary: Black holes get bigger as they merge, the LIGO Collaboration confirmed with a new observation that could finally prove a decades-old Stephen Hawking theory.

title: When is the fall equinox, and why does it happen?
summary: On Monday, Sept. 22, day and night will be nearly equal in length as Earth's axis is side-on to the sun, officially beginning autumn in the Northern Hemisphere.

title: These scientists left the US in Trump’s first term: their tips on taking the leap
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02895-y

Nature talks to researchers about why they moved and how they relocated successfully.
body: Nature, Published online: 10 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02895-y Nature talks to researchers about why they moved and how they relocated successfully.

title: Using biobanks to boost research: a how-to guide
summary:
Nature, Published online: 10 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02813-2

From large national databases to bespoke sample collections, biobanks offer a wealth of avenues for scientific enquiry.
body: Nature, Published online: 10 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02813-2 From large national databases to bespoke sample collections, biobanks offer a wealth of avenues for scientific enquiry.

title: 'Once-in-a-millennium' event: Approach of 'potentially hazardous' asteroid Apophis will be visible to the naked eye
summary: In 2029, asteroid Apophis will skim safely past Earth, where it will be visible to billions. For scientists, it's a once-in-a-millennium planetary experiment.

title: NASA spots bizarre 'turtle' on Mars
summary: NASA's Perseverance rover has photographed a peculiar rock formation that looks eerily like a turtle poking its head out from its protective shell.

title: Scientists create first-ever visible time crystals using light — and they could one day appear on $100 bills
summary: The visible patterns produced by the time crystals could be used for data storage and anti-counterfeiting designs.

title: Gigantic 'letter S' spotted on the sun just before a 'dark eruption' hurls a fiery shadow at Earth
summary: A giant S-shape structure, around 10 times wider than Earth, recently appeared in the center of the sun, moments before our home star unleashed an even larger plume of plasma that later crashed into our planet.

title: I watched scientists view the interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS in real time. Here's what they saw.
summary: The Gemini South Observatory opened up its telescope to the public as a team of astronomers looked at the interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS in real time.

title: Giant 'chessboard' surrounds Idaho river in bizarre astronaut photo — Earth from space
summary: A 2017 astronaut photo shows an unusual checkered pattern surrounding a river, just south of the Canadian border. The unique sight is the result of a forest management initiative dating to the 1800s.

body: Nature, Published online: 09 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02599-3 An encounter with blood-suckers persuades a researcher to back a new scientific institute, and an effort to standardize the printing of mathematical formulae, in our weekly dip into Nature’s archive.

body: Nature, Published online: 09 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02526-6 Researchers have used epidemiological models to determine whether the wave of riots in 1789 known as the Great Fear spread through irrational panic or rational protest.

title: 'Blood moon' gallery: Stunning snaps from last night's total lunar eclipse
summary: A "blood moon" hovered above parts of the globe last night. And while North America missed out, we've rounded up some of the best photographs of September 2025's total lunar eclipse.

title: Why does the universe exist?
summary: The universe exists because matter and antimatter are not good friends.

title: The surprising ways bridges resist collapse
summary:

body: Nature, Published online: 08 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02881-4 Researchers have uncovered six mechanisms that could be reinforced to prevent steel truss bridges collapsing.

summary:

Misconduct is rare in science, but there are worries about a detritus of fake papers in the scientific literature. In this podcast, we explore why misco…
body: Nature, Published online: 08 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02877-0 Misconduct is rare in science, but there are worries about a detritus of fake papers in the scientific literature. In this podcast, we explore why misconduct happens and how to tackle it.

title: Scientific objectivity is a myth — here's why
summary: Cultural ideas are inextricably entwined with the people who do science, the questions they ask, the assumptions they hold and the conclusions they land on.

title: فيديو.. الشرع يحضر حفل تخرج زوجته لطيفة من الجامعة
summary: تداول رواد مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي مقطع فيديو يوثق حضور الرئيس السوري أحمد الشرع حفل تخرج عقيلته لطيفة دروبي من جامعة إدلب كلية الآداب والعلوم الإنسانية.

title: James Webb telescope finds a warped 'Butterfly Star' shedding its chrysalis — Space photo of the week
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has snapped a new view of a planet-forming disk within the Taurus star-forming region.

title: Do humans and chimps really share nearly 99% of their DNA?
summary: The frequently cited 99% similarity between human and chimp DNA overlooks key differences in the genomes.

title: Are alpha males real?
summary: The term "alpha male" was coined in 1970 to describe wolves. But what does science think about the term now?

title: كسرت الأرقام القياسية.. "طفلة خارقة" تحصد الثانوية الفرنسية
summary: أعلنت وزارة التربية الوطنية الفرنسية، الجمعة، حصول تلميذة في التاسعة من العمر على شهادة البكالوريا في يوليو، لتصبح بذلك أصغر شخص ينال هذه الشهادة، وذلك في تأكيد لمعلومات نشرتها قناة "فرانس إنفو".

title: بعد وفاته.. "حمى أرماني" تجتاح الإنترنت
summary: ازدادت عمليات البحث على الإنترنت عن أزياء قديمة من العلامة التجارية للمصمم الإيطالي الشهير جورجيو أرماني منذ وفاته، الخميس، في الوقت الذي تردد فيه المتسوقون على منافذ بيع الملابس المستعملة للبحث عن تصاميمه.

title: Will the James Webb telescope lead us to alien life? Scientists say we're getting closer than ever.
summary: Three years into its mission, the James Webb Space Telescope has advanced the search for alien life more than any machine before it. What will it find next?

title: Fishers discover first-of-its-kind bright orange shark with two rare conditions in Caribbean
summary: Fishers caught a bright orange shark off Costa Rica that had albinism, alongside the species' first scientifically documented case of an extremely rare condition called xanthism.

title: بالفيديو.. أنغام تفاجئ جمهور مهرجان العلمين
summary: فاجأت النجمة المصرية أنغام الجمهور بحضورها حفل فرقة "كايروكي" في مهرجان العلمين، في أول ظهور علني في حفل غنائي بعد رحلة علاج بالخارج.
